nodes.name: Filter_Servicie_Name_Count
nodes.lql: `select *, CASE WHEN service_name_count < 5 THEN 2 ELSE 3 END AS fidelity_score, 3 AS risk_score from Group_by_Asset where service_name_count >0`

nodes.name: Group_by_Asset
nodes.lql: `select Computer, src_user,src_ip,count(distinct service_name) service_name_count, concat_ws(',',collect_set(service_name))  service_name_list, min(lhub_ts) as lhub_ts from Potential_Kerberoasting group by  Computer, src_user, src_ip `

nodes.name: Create_Output
nodes.lql: `SELECT lhub_ts AS alert_time, "LH00167" AS alert_id, "Potential Kerberoasting" AS alert_title, "Kerberoasting" AS technique, "Credential Access" AS tactic, fidelity_score*risk_score AS lhub_score,fidelity_score,risk_score,  " " AS additional_data, src_user, " " AS src_ip, " " AS dest_ip, Computer AS src_machine_name, " " AS dest_machine_name FROM Filter_Servicie_Name_Count`

nodes.name: LogicHub_MDR_Format_Alert_for_Sumo
nodes.description: Format event output to send to SumoLogic destination
nodes.title: LogicHub MDR: Format Alert for Sumo

stepParams.title: LogicHub MDR: Format Alert for Sumo

contentMetadata.name: LogicHub MDR: Format Alert for Sumo

nodes.iconTitle: Module: LogicHub MDR: Format Alert for Sumo

data.name: Potential_Kerberoasting
data.query:
_sourceCategory=server/windows/events* event_id="4769" "0x40810000"  "0x17" "Audit Success"
| parse "Computer = \"*\";" as Computer nodrop
| parse "Client Address:\t\t*\r\n" as src_ip nodrop
| parse "Account Name:\t\t*\r\n" as src_user nodrop
| parse "Service Name:\t\t*\r\n" as Service_Name nodrop
|where !(service_name matches "*$*") AND !(src_user matches "*$*")

connectionTypeDetail.query:
_sourceCategory=server/windows/events* event_id="4769" "0x40810000"  "0x17" "Audit Success"
| parse "Computer = \"*\";" as Computer nodrop
| parse "Client Address:\t\t*\r\n" as src_ip nodrop
| parse "Account Name:\t\t*\r\n" as src_user nodrop
| parse "Service Name:\t\t*\r\n" as Service_Name nodrop
|where !(service_name matches "*$*") AND !(src_user matches "*$*")

modules.name: LogicHub MDR: Format Alert for Sumo
modules.description: Format event output to send to a SumoLogic destination

templateNodes.name: alert_output_for_sumo
ensure_defined_fields_exist
templateNodes.templateLQL: ensureTableHasColumns(comment_ensure_table_has_columns, "lhub_score, lhub_ts, alert_title, alert_time, alert_id, alert_type, technique, tactic, risk_score, fidelity_score, additional_data, attack_chain, dest_ip, dest_machine_name, dest_machine_fqdn, dest_nt_domain, dest_port, dest_user, src_ip, src_machine_name, src_machine_fqdn, src_nt_domain, src_port, src_user")

templateNodes.name: final_columns
templateNodes.templateLQL:
`SELECT 
/* Required/standard fields first */
lh__new_score AS lhub_score,
lh__new_ts AS lhub_ts,
lh__new_ts AS alert_time,
lh_batch_end, lh_batch_id, lh_hostname, lh_alert_id,
alert_id,

/* Legacy support for "alert_title" which is now called "alert_type" */
COALESCEEMPTY(alert_type, alert_title) AS alert_type,

technique, tactic, risk_score, fidelity_score,

/* All other supported fields */
additional_data, attack_chain, dest_ip, dest_machine_name, dest_machine_fqdn, dest_nt_domain, dest_port, dest_user, src_ip, src_machine_name, src_machine_fqdn, src_nt_domain, src_port, src_user

FROM calculate_new_score_and_time`

templateNodes.name: calculate_new_score_and_time
templateNodes.templateLQL:
`SELECT 
/* If lhub_score = 0, keep it 0, otherwise use the greater of the original value or risk times fidelity */
CASE DOUBLE(lhub_score) WHEN 0 THEN DOUBLE(lhub_score) ELSE GREATEST(risk_score * fidelity_score, DOUBLE(lhub_score)) END AS lh__new_score,

/* For timestamp, look first for alert_time, then lhub_ts, then batch end time */
CASE
  WHEN BIGINT(alert_time) IS NOT NULL THEN BIGINT(alert_time)
  WHEN BIGINT(lhub_ts) IS NOT NULL THEN BIGINT(lhub_ts) ELSE BIGINT(GET_JSON_OBJECT(lhub_execution_metadata, "$.interval_end_millis"))
END AS lh__new_ts,

REGEXP_EXTRACT(GET_JSON_OBJECT(lhub_execution_metadata, "$.batch_url"), '://(.*?)/') AS lh_hostname,
REGEXP_EXTRACT(GET_JSON_OBJECT(lhub_execution_metadata, "$.batch_url"), '(batch-\\d+)$') AS lh_batch_id,
BIGINT(GET_JSON_OBJECT(lhub_execution_metadata, "$.interval_end_millis")) AS lh_batch_end,

/* Generate a unique (mostly) event ID from the batch number + lhub_id */
BIGINT(PRINTF('%s%s', REGEXP_EXTRACT(GET_JSON_OBJECT(lhub_execution_metadata, "$.batch_url"), 'batch-(\\d+)$'), lhub_id)) AS lh_alert_id,
*
FROM add_batch_metadata`

templateNodes.name: comment_ensure_table_has_columns
templateNodes.templateLQL:
`
/* Since some columns are only conditionally required, there has to be a step to explicitly check for values in those fields anyway, so to keep it simple, all possible fields are protected in ensureTableHasColumns, and some are validated later to ensure that they have a value.

Fields supported but not part of the final JSON schema:
- lhub_score - can be used to override final score
- lhub_ts - when available, used to calculate alert_time
- alert_title - legacy support, but since renamed to alert_type

Not expected from input but allowed when available:
- alert_time: calculated from lhub_ts or batch time, but if this is available then we'll accept it as truth

After that, ALL SUPPORTED FIELDS from supported schema
https://logichub.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CON/pages/797671425/Output+Schema+for+LogicHub+Content
*/

select * from %%%parent0%%%`

templateNodes.name: check_for_required_fields
templateNodes.templateLQL:
`/*
Once all calculations are done, verify that all the required fields have values.
Note that some fields allow empty strings for the time being, as long as they aren't null. This is just to allow us to transition into this new alert schema while we figure it all out.
*/

SELECT *,
CASE
    /* array_sort will put nulls at the end, so this is a quick way to check all required inputs at once */
    WHEN ELEMENT_AT(ARRAY_SORT(ARRAY(alert_id, alert_type, technique, tactic, risk_score, fidelity_score)), -1) IS NULL THEN 'One or more required inputs is missing or null. Required fields: alert_id, alert_type, technique, tactic, risk_score, fidelity_score'
    WHEN TRIM(alert_id) = '' THEN 'alert_id cannot be empty'
    WHEN TRIM(alert_type) = '' THEN 'alert_type cannot be empty'
    WHEN risk_score NOT IN (1, 2, 3) THEN PRINTF('Invalid value for risk_score (%s). Acceptable values are from 1 (low), 2 (medium) and 3 (high).', risk_score)
    WHEN fidelity_score NOT IN (1, 2, 3) THEN PRINTF('Invalid value for fidelity_score (%s). Acceptable values are from 1 (low), 2 (medium) and 3 (high).', fidelity_score)
    WHEN FLOAT(lhub_score) IS NULL THEN 'Unable to calculate lhub_score from provided columns'
    WHEN lhub_score > 10 OR lhub_score < 0 THEN PRINTF('Invalid value for lhub_score (%s). Acceptable values are from 0-10.', lhub_score)
END AS error

FROM final_columns`

modules.author: chad@logichub.com
